Earlier Today we kicked off our Andersen Africa New Managers School in Kigali, bringing together professionals from our member firms across the continent.

This practical development program focuses on building essential skills in management, communication, team leadership, and business development.
Participants are sharing knowledge and insights to help create value for our clients across Africa.

Looking forward to the connections and growth that will come from this collaborative experience!

Yesterday, the Andersen Africa Regional Board sat down with the CEO of Kigali International Financial Centre (KIFC), Nick Barigye, for a strategic roundtable discussion. The conversation focused on "What KIFC Offers to Africa and the World," exploring Rwanda's rise as a competitive financial hub and the opportunities this creates across the continent. Our sincere appreciation to KIFC for the thoughtful exchange and valuable insights.

ACOA 2025 officially kicked off today in Kigali, and the energy has been extraordinary! Hundreds of accounting professionals gathered around the theme "Creating Value for Africa," and it's been inspiring to engage with so many brilliant minds.

A big thank you to everyone who stopped by Andersen's booth‚Äîwe loved connecting with you and sharing ideas. We're excited to keep the momentum going tomorrow!

Meet the Andersen Team at ACOA 2025!

Our Directors James Muigai and Timothy Gatonye, along with Ishimwe Claude and Vanessa Semugaza, will represent Andersen at ACOA 2025. The team looks forward to sharing insights and discussing industry developments throughout the congress.

Visit our booth to learn how our tax, legal, and advisory services can benefit your organization.

Creating Value for Africa! Andersen is honored to be a Valued Participating Sponsor at the Africa Congress of Accountants (ACOA) 2025 in Kigali. Join us May 6-9 as we discuss the future of accounting and finance on the continent.

As we celebrate Labor Day, here's to the team that brings passion, dedication, and a whole lot of energy to everything we do! Together we don't just work‚Äîwe create, innovate, and occasionally raise our hands in perfect unison! üí™üéâ

From all of us at Andersen Rwanda, wishing you a day filled with well-deserved rest and celebration. Your hard work moves mountains!

During our visit to the Nyanza Genocide Memorial, we experienced something beyond words. The memorial doesn't just present history‚Äîit envelops you in truth that cannot be denied.

In the quiet halls, among preserved memories, we felt the profound absence of tens of thousands whose futures were stolen. Time seemed to stand still as we confronted both tremendous loss and remarkable human resilience.

Our team walked away transformed, understanding that remembrance carries purpose. It compels us to bear witness, to acknowledge painful truths, and to participate actively in building a future where such atrocities cannot happen again.

Rwanda's journey shows us how a nation can confront darkness and still choose light‚Äîhow remembrance becomes not just retrospection but a foundation for renewal. We honor this legacy by committing ourselves to the values of unity, truth, and collective healing.

Remember. Unite. Renew.

Rwanda has introduced comprehensive VAT exemptions for financial and insurance services through a new Ministerial Order, aligning with global best practices and strengthening its position as an emerging financial hub. Jean Claude Nshimiyimana, Corporate Services Lead at Andersen in Rwanda, explains how these changes will benefit banks, insurers, fintechs, and investors through reduced operational costs and improved profit margins.

Key highlights include:
‚Ä¢ Exemptions covering core banking, insurance, capital markets, and forex transactions
‚Ä¢ Reduced VAT burdens enabling expanded lending capacity
‚Ä¢ Lower insurance premium costs facilitating rural market expansion
‚Ä¢ Higher net yields for investors due to tax-exempt financial returns

This Ministerial Order on VAT-Exempt Financial and Insurance Services exhibits Rwanda's allegiance to creating a competitive financial ecosystem in East Africa and presents significant opportunities for businesses and investors in the region.
